meanings.definition: To immerse briefly in a liquid.
meanings.sent1: She dipped her brush in the paint.
meanings.sent2: The children dipped their toes in the cool water.
meanings.sent3: The cat dipped its paw into the milk and licked it off.
meanings.sent4: The sun dipped below the horizon, painting the sky in hues of orange.
meanings.sent5: He dipped the cookie in the milk until it was soaked through.

meanings.definition: To lower or drop something quickly.
meanings.sent1: He dipped his head to avoid hitting the low doorway.
meanings.sent2: The magician dipped his hand into the hat and pulled out a rabbit.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel dipped its acorn into the hole it dug in the ground.
meanings.sent4: The dancer gracefully dipped her partner during the performance.
meanings.sent5: She dipped the spoon into the soup and blew on it to cool it down.

meanings.definition: To decline or decrease in value or quality.
meanings.sent1: The temperature dipped as the sun set.
meanings.sent2: The stock market dipped after the company's announcement.
meanings.sent3: His mood dipped when he heard the bad news.
meanings.sent4: The singer's popularity dipped after the scandal.
meanings.sent5: The quality of the product dipped due to poor manufacturing.
